WorkItem.ClosedComment: This issue has reached 60 days without response. If this is still an issue, please resubmit with reference to the currently affected versions and any necessary files.
WorkItem.Description: I am having an issue where my computer hard freezes when i attempt to load Rawr. I am running Windows XP home edition Version 2002, P4. Any advice would be appreciated, lemme know if more information is needed to properly diagnose this issue.
WorkItem.Summary: Computer freezing on start-up of Rawr

Comments.Message: Make sure you're using the latest version of Rawr. Beyond that, that's a system problem, not Rawr-specific (ie, virus, corruption, etc).
Current version is installed. I have an Anti-Virus program and have done full scans, is there anyway to tell if its a corruption of sorts?

Does the whole system hang/become unresponsive?  E.G. does the mouse stop moving? crtl+alt+del doesn't work,etc?
Do you have system debugging enabled? 
Or Verifier?

Yeah, my whole system becomes unresponsive. My mouse becomes locked in the middle of my screen and ctrl+alt+del has no effect. Only way for me to recover my computer is for me to manually shut it down. By system debugging do you mean error reporting turned on for rawr.exe?
I couldn't even write a program to do that if I wanted. That's gotta be some low level system problem, or quite possibly a hardware issue. Bad RAM is a likely possibility.

look for a file on c:\ called boot.ini (it's hidden by default)
at the end of one of the last line in the INI file, does it have any reference to debugging?
e.g.: /debug or /debugport or /baudrate ??

As Astrylian mentions, there's probably an underlying system problem here.  But I've seen times that a machine can hang if there's a kernel exception thrown and the system expects a remote debugger to be attached.  Or you can just attach your boot.ini here, and I'll inspect it for ya.
Alright here is my boot.ini file, if you don't mind taking a look at it.

yeah, everything looks normal in your boot.ini.  So I can't think of what the specific problem is.  I know that I could research it more, but in essence, there no user-mode application that I know of can do what you describe.  All things that lock the machine like that are kernel mode. Does it only freeze with Rawr?  Are there other applications that can cause the same behaviour?

The only other time my computer freezes like this is when i attempt to open the in-depth Nvidia Menu/Options. When I open this menu my mouse becomes stuck where it was and no commands work and I have to end up manually rebooting my computer. I have an updated driver for my graphics card and have researched this through Nvidia forums but I have failed to retrieve any helpful information nor a solution. Maybe they are related? When I execute Rawr my computer shows a blue square in the middle of the screen before it completely locks up, so I am left with a blue box in the middle of my desktop with my cursor stuck smack dab in the middle and the computer will not respond to anything but a manual reboot.
